channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned bicycle frames - 484 Caledonian Road N7 9RP, 6th December
item.description:
Outside 484 Caledonian Rd, London N7 9RP; 2 abandoned & stripped bicycle frames with sharp edges. 2 wheels locked to a bicycle rack . Using up space for other cyclists and dangerous sharp edges. Please remove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 484, Caledonian Road, Holloway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MWB water stopcock cover is a trip hazard, 6th December
item.description:
The MWB water stopcock cover at this location is broken and protruding. It is a trip hazard.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Oakways, Eltham

item.title: Lights out, 6th December
item.description:
It appears that the timer/sensor that operates the lights to the garages / service Rd at the rear of Lucey way between Dockley Rd and Rail Sidings Rd Is either faulty or set wrong. The lights come on but go off again late evening. Also the walk through and stairwell lights between 72 and 74 Lucey Way are out. They may possibly be on the same circuit as the service rd lights.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Priter Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping, 5th December
item.description:
There is constant fly-tipping on this road, and the waste bins are regularly overflowing. Residents are clearly dumping their rubbish on the street because the bins cannot cope with the volume. This situation is unacceptable please investigate and fix it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Consistent fly tipping by 219 Ilderton Road, 5th December
item.description:
Getting really fed up but keep seeing repeated general waste dumped outside 219 Ilderton overspilling unto 221 and across the pavement into the street. have seen rats and foxes attracted by the rubbish. You need to deal with this immediately and deal with the occupants at 219 as they are causing a serious health hazard. You also need to consider a different solution for waste disposal: they are simply not enough green bins!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree blocking highway, 5th December
item.description:
An extremely large branch is blocking 1.5 lanes of the highway making it difficult to cross the round about and potentially very dangerous. The highway is blocked going down the hill which means there is no safe walking route on this side for pedestrians. With nearly zebra crossings on this road people pushing prams/ using wheelchairs need to have clear assess.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
